heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 10th for total rainfall with 20.16mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.3mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 24.8 hours.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.7°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 4.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (down 4.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 214 m), outside temperature (down 2.0°C), feels like temperature (down 2.7°C), and inside temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 77.6m lower than yesterday, 214.3m lower than the past week, 201.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 523m to 933m and averaged 566.5m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Periods of rain anticipated, overcast skies with low cloud, and the light is absent. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
